intro: Agrostophyllum elmeri, commonly known as the Elmer's grass-leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Agrostophyllum elmeri is often found in rocky outcrops and open shrublands, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
